note.p: Birth: Fieldhead Farmhouse, parish of Birstall, West Riding of Yorkshire, England (13 March 1733)
Death: Northumberland, Pennsylvania, USA (06 February 1804)
Burial: Quakers' burial-ground, Northumberland, Pennsylvania, USA
Profession: Presbyterian Minister
Research Field: Chemistry, electricity, natural philosophy, theology
Education: Batley Grammar School (1745), Daventry Academy (1751)
Career: Minister, Needham Market, Suffolk; Minister, Nantwich, Cheshire; taught in Warrington; librarian-companion to Lord Shelburne (1774); Minister of the New Meeting, Birmingham (1780-1790)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 12/06/1766
Medals/Prizes: Copley Medal 1772
